Bystander01.synopsis: A goblin on the floor of Moonrise Towers, chatting absently while being a bystander. His commentary changes depending on how the player handled the grove.

Zhent01.synopsis: A Zhentarim agent guarding a trader from her organisation.
Zhent01.how_to_trigger: in main menu: loadlevel SCL_Main_Agoto -173; 23; -177speak with Erna

Guard00.synopsis: A guard watching the alarm system on the ground floor of Moonrise Tower. He's brusque to anyone who approaches.
Guard00.how_to_trigger: - Load WLD_SCL- Goto -150, 179- Speak to the drow (Fanatic Dorikel)

AD_BazEntranceGuard_002.synopsis: The guard points the player towards the execution room after they first enter the tower.
AD_BazEntranceGuard_002.how_to_trigger: Enter Moonrise Towers, walk past S_MOO_BazEntranceGuard_002 (before execution is complete).Will only play once.

PAD_SharranObservation.synopsis: Shadowheart notices that Ketheric is no longer a Sharran
PAD_SharranObservation.how_to_trigger: 1. Learn into Moonrise2. Learn about Ketheric

Zhent02.synopsis: A Zhentarim agent guarding Roah Moonglow. She's looking around at the growing power of the church and feeling wary of it.
Zhent02.how_to_trigger: in main menu: loadlevel SCL_Main_Agoto -173; 23; -177speak with Yerle

Bystander04.synopsis: This human is waiting to speak to Z'rell. A big tough guy but is full  of hope that the Absolute will be proud of him. Should have a faint air of a stalker.

Bystander00.synopsis: A goblin on the floor of Moonrise Towers, chatting absently while being a bystander. This one is worried about the other goblins that were sent to the execution room.

BazaarStander_007.synopsis: This novice has joined the church in the hopes of being elevated to True Soul. She's not here for personal gain, but seeking an actual religious experience - one she believes we've already been blessed to have.

AD_ZhentarimCrew.synopsis: Inside Moonrise Towers, the Zhentarim Guards and Merchant are making a deal with a rising cult. These are their idle exchanges.

AD_GuardRejectPilgrims.synopsis: The guard has decided to get rid of the pilgrims, sending them to their death in the shadow lands, their bodies found later in TWN.
AD_GuardRejectPilgrims.how_to_trigger: Talk to Acolyte Belub in Moonrise and tell him the pilgrims are not needed. He will walk over to them and play the AD.

AD_Pilgrims.synopsis: The pilgrms have travelled far to speak with the Absolute, but they are being told to stay in the main entrance. Belub is deciding what to do with them in the mean time.
AD_Pilgrims.how_to_trigger: Enter Moonrise Towers and wait by the group of pilgrims in the main Bazaar area.

Zhent00.synopsis: A Zhentarim trader from the goblin camp. Roah will react based on your actions if you've met her, or give a brief summary of the Zhentarim's connection to the Absolute if not.
Zhent00.how_to_trigger: Approach Roah Moonglow on the ground floor of Moonrise Towers. teleport S_Gob_Quartermaster

AD_BugbearThrow.synopsis: The bugbear vendor in Moonrise spends his time throwing an axe at a target. He is quite full of himself and proud of his strength.
AD_BugbearThrow.how_to_trigger: Load SCL_Main_Agoto -166; 22; -166Wait for ADs after he throws his axe

AD_GoblinsListening.synopsis: The Bazaar Goblins are listening into the execution, worried about their own necks.
AD_GoblinsListening.how_to_trigger: Called every time S_MOO_BazaarStander_002 walks up the stairs before the execution scene is completed.

BazEntranceGuard.synopsis: Standing at the entrance of Moonrise Tower, the guard is keeping eye on all the fresh blood seeking audience with the Absolute. The player can influence the guard to send the pilgrims to their death in Town, or to take a chance on them and send them as fodder to colony. Either way the pilgrims will have a bad time.

BazaarStander_006.synopsis: A novice of the church of the Absolute, by turns praying to herself or speaking to us, who she sees as a leading follower of her god

Bystander03.synopsis: A frightened bystander on the ground floor of Moonrise Tower. He's deeply upset by the scrying eyes wandering the tower. He's caught between religious rapture and terror - he dreads and loves the Absolute in equal measure.

Bystander02.synopsis: A goblin on the floor of Moonrise Towers, chatting absently while being a bystander.

Guard01.synopsis: A guard watching the alarm system on the ground floor of Moonrise Tower. He love and respects authority, and enjoys the thought of failure being punished.

AD_GoblinsAfterExecution.synopsis: The Bazaar Goblins talk among themselves after the execution scene.
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution.how_to_trigger: Complete the execution scene at MOO Towers

BazaarStander_005.synopsis: A supplicant who has just arrived at the seat of his religion. He  survived a harrowing journey through cursed lands - his family did not, and he is trying to rationalise that, becoming all the more fanaticin the process.

Bystander01_0.speaker: Brawler Weneg
Bystander01_0.text: Heard a rumour some do-gooder stopped a horde of Absolutists from getting their hands on a load of druids in some grove.

Bystander01_1.speaker: Brawler Weneg
Bystander01_1.text: Whoever it was better pray the General doesn't smoke 'em out. Be a bloodbath, so it would.

Bystander01_2.speaker: Brawler Weneg
Bystander01_2.text: Times are changing fast. Glad I'm here to see it.

Bystander01_4.speaker: Brawler Weneg
Bystander01_4.text: Eya, you missed all the fun. We caught a bunch of tieflings on the road and slaughtered 'em.

Bystander01_3.speaker: Brawler Weneg
Bystander01_3.text: Ah well. Least you can get an eyeful of the General, while he's holding court.

Bystander01_5.speaker: Brawler Weneg
Bystander01_5.text: Heard that rat's nest of druids was burned to ash. Praise the Absolute!

Bystander01_6.speaker: Brawler Weneg
Bystander01_6.text: Hasn't improved General Ketheric's mood much, though. Court's in session in the inner hall - reckon the hammer'll fall hard.

Zhent01_0.speaker: Erna
Zhent01_0.text: You trying to get me in trouble?
Zhent01_0.context: NodeContext: Smiling but fobbing us off.

Zhent01_1.speaker: Erna
Zhent01_1.text: It's Roah you want. We only talk when you've misbehaved.
Zhent01_1.context: NodeContext: Pleasant and placid - a fact, not a threat. Name is pronounced ROW-ah (row as in 'row your boat')

Guard00_5.speaker: Adept Dorikel
Guard00_5.text: I saw it, True Soul. The army. They're nearly ready. It's nearly time.

Guard00_1.speaker: Adept Dorikel
Guard00_1.text: Us. We are so many. And we are marching to Baldur's Gate, as soon as the Absolute gives word.

Guard00_4.speaker: Adept Dorikel
Guard00_4.text: I've never been to battle. I've never been to war. But I feel so... calm. Ready.

Guard00_10.speaker: Player
Guard00_10.text: And when the hour draws near...?

Guard00_3.speaker: Adept Dorikel
Guard00_3.text: I'm trained as an assassin. House Hekar. Perhaps I can serve as a scout - or special operations.

Guard00_6.speaker: Adept Dorikel
Guard00_6.text: When the call comes, I'll be ready.

Guard00_7.speaker: Adept Dorikel
Guard00_7.text: The General is inside. I've never seen him so near. It's all happening...

AD_BazEntranceGuard_002_0.speaker: Zealot Brinn
AD_BazEntranceGuard_002_0.text: Another True Soul. The Disciple will want to see you - through the main doors.

PAD_SharranObservation_0.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_SharranObservation_0.text: There is nothing Sharran about this man. He has betrayed the Dark Lady.

Zhent02_0.speaker: Yerle
Zhent02_0.text: Ain't looking to convert, True Soul. Gods mind their mess, I mind mine.
Zhent02_0.context: NodeContext: Respectful but flat refusal - most Absolutists want to convert others, and she's pre-empting it.

Zhent02_1.speaker: Yerle
Zhent02_1.text: This was funny when it was just goblins branding arses. But you lot mean business, eh?
Zhent02_1.context: NodeContext: Wary. Your church was a funny joke to her once, no longer.

Bystander04_0.speaker: Pilgrim Iong
Bystander04_0.text: The Disciple has returned upstairs but... perhaps she'll still see me.
Bystander04_0.context: NodeContext: Wants to go, psyching himself up a bit. Now he has his chance and he's a bit scared

Bystander04_1.speaker: Pilgrim Iong
Bystander04_1.text: An audience with the Absolute. That is my destiny. My right.

Bystander04_2.speaker: Pilgrim Iong
Bystander04_2.text: Every caravan brings more faithful for the Absolute. But I will stand among the first.

Bystander04_3.speaker: Pilgrim Iong
Bystander04_3.text: Back of the line. I'll be the first of us to swear to the General.

Bystander00_0.speaker: Brawler Orik
Bystander00_0.text: You're the best True Soul I ever met.

Bystander00_1.speaker: Brawler Orik
Bystander00_1.text: Bunch of the others were rounded up in the main hall a while ago. They ain't come back...

Bystander00_2.speaker: Brawler Orik
Bystander00_2.text: Still not sure why they brought us all here. Kinda worryin' me.

Bystander00_3.speaker: Brawler Orik
Bystander00_3.text: I won't fail the Absolute like the others. Honest I won't - I was always the smartest.

Bystander00_4.speaker: Brawler Orik
Bystander00_4.text: Heard you put in a good word for our mates - cheers.

Bystander00_5.speaker: Brawler Orik
Bystander00_5.text: I'm on my best behaviour, I swear.

BazaarStander_007_0.speaker: Pilgrim Taima
BazaarStander_007_0.text: I hear you've been summoned for an audience with Her. You will return changed, I'm sure of it.
BazaarStander_007_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Wishing us well - we're about to get our 'reward'

BazaarStander_007_1.speaker: Pilgrim Taima
BazaarStander_007_1.text: I will join your ranks one day, True Soul. That is the Absolute's promise.

BazaarStander_007_2.speaker: Pilgrim Taima
BazaarStander_007_2.text: I will pray for you, True Soul.
BazaarStander_007_2.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Kind, wishing us well

BazaarStander_007_3.speaker: Pilgrim Taima
BazaarStander_007_3.text: They say the General cannot die. Perhaps... perhaps that will be the Absolute's gift to us all.

BazaarStander_007_4.speaker: Pilgrim Taima
BazaarStander_007_4.text: Perhaps I will be blessed as you are. But if not, I will serve in whatever way the General sees fit.
BazaarStander_007_4.context: InternalNodeContext: Ketheric is still in private council dealing with some cultists who failed him. Default state on player's first arrival to tower.NodeContext: Awe of us

BazaarStander_007_5.speaker: Pilgrim Taima
BazaarStander_007_5.text: You're one of Her blessed, aren't you? To hear Her voice... I cannot imagine.
BazaarStander_007_5.context: InternalNodeContext: Ketheric is still in private council dealing with some cultists who failed him. Default state on player's first arrival to tower.NodeContext: Just happy to be here

AD_ZhentarimCrew_4.speaker: Yerle
AD_ZhentarimCrew_4.text: You sure you don't want me to check those crates? Be nice to know what we're shipping.
AD_ZhentarimCrew_4.context: NodeContext: Picking up a topic they've clearly already discussed. Her boss is doing a deal and she doesn't like being in the dark

AD_ZhentarimCrew_3.speaker: Roah Moonglow
AD_ZhentarimCrew_3.text: Erna, remind your sister why I pay you both so much.
AD_ZhentarimCrew_3.context: NodeContext: Maintaining a smiling facade. Asking one of her bodyguards to explain to the other why they shouldn't ask questions.

AD_ZhentarimCrew_1.speaker: Erna
AD_ZhentarimCrew_1.context: NodeContext: Bored, reciting as if she's had to do it a dozen times before

AD_ZhentarimCrew_5.speaker: Erna
AD_ZhentarimCrew_5.text: That bugbear keeps looking over, I'll feed him his own loincloth.

AD_ZhentarimCrew_0.speaker: Roah Moonglow
AD_ZhentarimCrew_0.text: These are our allies, Erna. I'll handle the diplomacy, you just keep looking pretty.
AD_ZhentarimCrew_0.context: NodeContext: Mocking, vaguely chiding her hair-trigger companion

AD_ZhentarimCrew_8.speaker: Roah Moonglow
AD_ZhentarimCrew_8.context: NodeContext: Half-mocking, half-prodding. Her dour bodyguards are looking around at cultists suspiciously

AD_ZhentarimCrew_6.speaker: Yerle
AD_ZhentarimCrew_6.text: Too damn friendly, you ask me. Gods-fearing folk ought to be more... fearful.
AD_ZhentarimCrew_6.context: NodeContext: The cultists bother her - they're too friendly, too faithful. It's not right.

AD_ZhentarimCrew_7.speaker: Roah Moonglow
AD_ZhentarimCrew_7.text: Why not join this Absolute, see what all the fuss is about?

AD_ZhentarimCrew_2.speaker: Yerle
AD_ZhentarimCrew_2.text: ...I'll stick with the monster I know, thanks.
AD_ZhentarimCrew_2.context: NodeContext: Wry, knows she's being mocked  - she's referring to her boss, who she knows is tougher than any cultist of the Absolute

AD_GuardRejectPilgrims_2.speaker: Acolyte Belub
AD_GuardRejectPilgrims_2.text: Right, pilgrims. You'll be scouting the perimeter of the war camp, looking for enemies.
AD_GuardRejectPilgrims_2.context: NodeContext: He's actually sending them to die in the curse, they just don't know it

AD_GuardRejectPilgrims_3.speaker: Pilgrim Iong
AD_GuardRejectPilgrims_3.text: But... the shadows. It's death out there without a guide.
AD_GuardRejectPilgrims_3.context: NodeContext: Masking fear - sounds like he;s being sent to his death

AD_GuardRejectPilgrims_1.speaker: Acolyte Belub
AD_GuardRejectPilgrims_1.text: The shadows won't harm you, so long as you know your place in the Absolute's design.

AD_GuardRejectPilgrims_0.speaker: Pilgrim Iong
AD_GuardRejectPilgrims_0.context: NodeContext: Firm, trying to have faith

AD_Pilgrims_0.speaker: Pilgrim Nalira
AD_Pilgrims_0.text: Brothers. Sister. Pray with me while we wait.

AD_Pilgrims_9.speaker: Pilgrim Farimorn
AD_Pilgrims_9.text: I'm not worthy. I... I never learned the words.

AD_Pilgrims_5.speaker: Pilgrim Nalira
AD_Pilgrims_5.text: Yes, you did. She gives them to you fully formed. Can you hear Her?
AD_Pilgrims_5.context: NodeContext: gentle and encouraging, sharing a special religious moment with someone (their 'god' is mentally controlling them in the background, giving them words to a prayer)

AD_Pilgrims_10.speaker: Pilgrim Farimorn
AD_Pilgrims_10.text: Of many hearts, one soul. Of many thoughts, one mind...
AD_Pilgrims_10.context: NodeContext: Halting but with increasing joy. He never learned this prayer but realizes his god is  giving him the words

AD_Pilgrims_3.speaker: Pilgrim Taima
AD_Pilgrims_3.text: To stand this close to Her power... I never thought I'd make it.

AD_Pilgrims_6.speaker: Pilgrim Iong
AD_Pilgrims_6.text: I wouldn't have, if not for the lantern-bearer. To think the Absolute graces such a creature as that...

AD_Pilgrims_8.speaker: Pilgrim Farimorn
AD_Pilgrims_8.text: We are each of us threads in Her design. Even those we once called monsters.

AD_Pilgrims_4.speaker: Pilgrim Nalira
AD_Pilgrims_4.text: Where do you hail from, brother?

AD_Pilgrims_2.speaker: Pilgrim Farimorn
AD_Pilgrims_2.text: I was a farrier in Dessarin Valley. Then the dreams came.

AD_Pilgrims_1.speaker: Pilgrim Iong
AD_Pilgrims_1.text: My brothers had the dreams too, same as me. But they wouldn't admit it.
AD_Pilgrims_1.context: NodeContext: Taking it down a notch from his aggressive bark

AD_Pilgrims_7.speaker: Pilgrim Nalira
AD_Pilgrims_7.text: The Absolute calls us all to Her design. Your family will answer - eventually.

Zhent00_62.speaker: Player
Zhent00_62.text: I've seen your sigil on cargo at the docks. The Zhentarim have joined the Absolute?

Zhent00_20.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_20.text: Ah, a new face come to bask in the light of the Absolute. How can I be of service, True Soul?

Zhent00_10.speaker: Player
Zhent00_10.text: 'New face'? We've met before - at the goblin camp.

Zhent00_48.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_48.text: ...of course! Just before some godless lunatic purged the place of every innocent soul.

Zhent00_18.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_18.text: A pity neither of us saw what happened.

Zhent00_68.speaker: Player
Zhent00_68.text: I've seen the docks. The Zhentarim have joined the Absolute?

Zhent00_26.speaker: Player
Zhent00_26.text: Careful. That sounds like an accusation.

Zhent00_27.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_27.text: The guilty ear hears blame in every breath. But you're among friends here, True Soul.

Zhent00_87.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_87.text: Look around. All manner of beasties united against the enemies of the Absolute.

Zhent00_66.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_66.text: Quite a god to bring them all together. And quite a fool who'd draw their ire, hm?

Zhent00_65.speaker: Player
Zhent00_65.text: You almost sound concerned for my safety.

Zhent00_71.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_71.text: More concerned that your business might be bad for my business.

Zhent00_74.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_74.text: So don't go kicking the hive while there's still some honey to be had.

Zhent00_23.speaker: Player
Zhent00_23.text: Drop the act. What are you actually doing here?

Zhent00_29.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_29.text: I'm not the one putting on an act, True Soul.  Though I'd mind how well you mouth your prayers.

Zhent00_6.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_6.text: Spend enough time in this place, and you might just start to believe them.

Zhent00_16.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_16.text: But look at me preaching, and when I'm only here to serve. Anything to trade, True Soul?

Zhent00_84.speaker: Player
Zhent00_84.text: You were rather quick to find your faith.

Zhent00_35.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_35.text: All who pass through here find their way to the Absolute, one way or another.

Zhent00_92.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_92.text: How painful the path is - well, that's up to them.

Zhent00_54.speaker: Player
Zhent00_54.text: Indeed. Can I see your wares?

Zhent00_38.speaker: Player
Zhent00_38.text: Really? You saw nothing at all?

Zhent00_93.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_93.text: Nothing worth repeating. Corpses don't much go in for commerce. Here, though?

Zhent00_64.speaker: Player
Zhent00_64.text: Speak for yourself. I had a pretty good view of the slaughter.

Zhent00_89.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_89.text: Better to keep that quiet, unless you want another look from the receiving end.

Zhent00_53.speaker: Player
Zhent00_53.text: I would hardly call the goblins there 'innocents'.

Zhent00_95.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_95.text: They were a little more frothing-at-the-mouth than faithful, true enough. Here, though?

Zhent00_57.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_57.text: Ah yes - around the time of Minthara's ill-fated expedition to the grove.

Zhent00_9.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_9.text: Such a pity there were no survivors to tell what truly happened there.

Zhent00_56.speaker: Player
Zhent00_56.text: If they failed, it was because their faith was weak.

Zhent00_4.speaker: Player
Zhent00_4.text: I actually had a pretty good view of the slaughter.

Zhent00_51.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_51.text: Ah, yes. The one who saved us from the infidels in the grove.

Zhent00_36.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_36.text: Can't say I've ever drawn steel on children. Suppose I'm not True Soul material.

Zhent00_80.speaker: Player
Zhent00_80.text: Spare me. I saw the docks - the Zhentarim have joined the cult.

Zhent00_81.speaker: Player
Zhent00_81.text: You didn't strike me as the bleeding heart type.

Zhent00_90.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_90.text: Oh, I'm sure they deserved it. I'm all for people getting what they deserve.

Zhent00_31.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_31.text: For now, I'll settle for getting you what you need. Anything to trade?

Zhent00_46.speaker: Player
Zhent00_46.text: Stick to trading, then. Show me your wares.

Zhent00_73.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_73.text: So we did. And it seems we both have a nose for where the real power lies - I've come to pay proper respect.

Zhent00_8.speaker: Player
Zhent00_8.text: Are you a follower of the Absolute?

Zhent00_5.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_5.text: Blessed by association, let's say. I come to pay proper respect to a new power.

Zhent00_33.speaker: Narrator
Zhent00_33.text: *The Zhentarim - a network of merchants and mercenaries known for deep coffers and shallow scruples.*

Zhent00_52.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_52.text: I'd bow, but the Zhentarim prefer to look their business partners in the eye.

Zhent00_79.speaker: Player
Zhent00_79.text: So the Zhentarim have allied themselves with the Absolute?

Zhent00_63.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_63.text: Waukeen's clipped coins, no. Faith is an over-flooded market. Transport, however -

Zhent00_76.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_76.text: These faithful folk need some goods moved into the city. Our ships are obliging - quietly.

Zhent00_97.speaker: Player
Zhent00_97.text: You're helping the cult expand for a payout. You're disgusting.

Zhent00_28.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_28.text: You know, you sound less and less like a true believer with every word.

Zhent00_44.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_44.text: But what would I know of faith? I cater to more earthly needs. Better we focus on that, hm?

Zhent00_32.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_32.text: Oh, True Soul, I couldn't burden your spirit with such material concerns. But I'm always happy to trade.

Zhent00_0.speaker: Player
Zhent00_0.text: You're a fool if you think this lot have any loyalty. They'll turn on you in a second.

Zhent00_86.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_86.text: Merchants like any other. Though we tend to see opportunity where others don't.

Zhent00_67.speaker: Player
Zhent00_67.text: What business do mercenaries have with a cult?

Zhent00_70.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_70.text: Oh come now - we're far more than just soldiers for hire. Have a bit more imagination.

Zhent00_19.speaker: Player
Zhent00_19.text: Lock eyes with the Zhent and gesture in Thieves' Cant: Discount?

Zhent00_47.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_47.text: For another in the business? Don't see why not. We can certainly afford it - business is booming.

Zhent00_88.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00_88.text: These faithful folk don't ask for much - just some cargo moved to the city. But my goodness do they pay generously.

Zhent00_45.speaker: Player
Zhent00_45.text: Do you have anything to trade?

AD_BugbearThrow_0.speaker: Lann Tarv
AD_BugbearThrow_0.text: I could hit a pixie from a hundred paces.
AD_BugbearThrow_0.context: NodeContext: congratulating himself on a well-thrown axe, while practicing

AD_BugbearThrow_1.speaker: Lann Tarv
AD_BugbearThrow_1.context: NodeContext: congratulating himself on a well-thrown axe, while practicing

AD_BugbearThrow_2.speaker: Lann Tarv
AD_BugbearThrow_2.context: NodeContext: while practicing axe-throwing - annoyed not to be with the bulk of the army

AD_BugbearThrow_3.speaker: Lann Tarv
AD_BugbearThrow_3.text: I should be on the frontline, cleaving skulls.
AD_BugbearThrow_3.context: NodeContext: while practicing axe-throwing - annoyed not to be with the bulk of the army

AD_Minthara_BazaarEntry_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_BazaarEntry_0.text: Converts, pilgrims, mercenaries. They all seek power, but will find only death.

AD_GoblinsListening_0.speaker: Brawler Weneg
AD_GoblinsListening_0.text: Enough! Just leave the bloody True Souls to their business.

AD_GoblinsListening_6.speaker: Brawler Wim
AD_GoblinsListening_6.text: And what's to say that couldn't be us? They say the General rewards them as serve him well.

AD_GoblinsListening_4.speaker: Brawler Orik
AD_GoblinsListening_4.text: And what about them who hang around his door like a bad smell?

AD_GoblinsListening_1.speaker: Brawler Wim
AD_GoblinsListening_1.text: Can't hear a damned thing in there.

AD_GoblinsListening_3.speaker: Brawler Weneg
AD_GoblinsListening_3.text: Aye, cos you ain't meant to. It's True Soul business - not for us.

AD_GoblinsListening_2.speaker: Brawler Orik
AD_GoblinsListening_2.text: If it's bad, you'll know. Disciple Z'rell ain't shy about handing out pain.

AD_GoblinsListening_7.speaker: Brawler Weneg
AD_GoblinsListening_7.text: You want to land us on the hook in there with them?

BazEntranceGuard_0.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard_0.text: Each pack of 'recruits' they bring in is worse than the last.
BazEntranceGuard_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Belub is not impressed by the new pilgrims who have shown up to join the Absolutes cause.

BazEntranceGuard_24.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard_24.text: Eh, beggin' your pardon, o' course. I'm sure you're mighty as they come.
BazEntranceGuard_24.context: NodeContext: Belub realises he might've accidentally insulted the player, and the player's an important person in this place

BazEntranceGuard_7.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard_7.text: The latest troupe didn't even make it past the door. Strong as gnome piss, the lot of 'em.

BazEntranceGuard_8.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard_8.text: Can't trust them to sweep the stables, let alone swing a sword.

BazEntranceGuard_20.speaker: Player
BazEntranceGuard_20.text: I thought the Absolute welcomed all believers?

BazEntranceGuard_23.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard_23.text: Not for me to say. All I know is they're bloody useless 'round here.

BazEntranceGuard_12.speaker: Player
BazEntranceGuard_12.text: They have potential. Great warriors have grown from less.

BazEntranceGuard_13.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard_13.text: No doubt - ain't for me to question them above me. I'm sure you know your business.
BazEntranceGuard_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowing deeply with reverance, no hesitation.

BazEntranceGuard_6.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard_6.text: I'll see they get all the help they need, True Soul. And they'll need quite a bit...

BazEntranceGuard_15.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard_15.text: Aye, and better fighters than them've been fertiliser on the fields too.

BazEntranceGuard_2.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard_2.text: We'd be better off without 'em, take my word.

BazEntranceGuard_21.speaker: Player
BazEntranceGuard_21.text: Then get rid of them. The undeserving should be purged.

BazEntranceGuard_10.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard_10.text: I-  yeah. Yeah, they're dead weight. Not real believers like us.
BazEntranceGuard_10.context: NodeContext: Slowly coming around to an opinion

BazEntranceGuard_19.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard_19.text: Thank you, True Soul. In Her name!

BazEntranceGuard_4.speaker: Player
BazEntranceGuard_4.text: Its not our place to question the Absolute's will.

BazEntranceGuard_27.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard_27.text: O' course - wouldn't dare! I'm sure She's got a plan.
BazEntranceGuard_27.context: NodeContext: Reiterating his faith to us

BazEntranceGuard_26.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard_26.text: And only She knows what part twits like them have to play in it.

BazEntranceGuard_1.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard_1.text: Prisoners will come 'round eventually. Advisor Balthazar is damned persuasive.
BazEntranceGuard_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped Balthazar (and this Nightsong) return to Moonrise. He's down in the Colony.NodeContext: Hint of relish, bloodlust - by 'persuasive' he means 'very good at torture'

BazEntranceGuard_5.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard_5.text: We just sent runners to the war camp, True Soul. This is bloody it.
BazEntranceGuard_5.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Barely contained excitment - can't wait to start marching

BazEntranceGuard_9.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard_9.text: I've got the novices in hand, True Soul. War camps, docks... plenty of work for those who serve Her.
BazEntranceGuard_9.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)NodeContext: Reassuring - we're not to worry, he's treating his subordinates like crap

BazEntranceGuard_11.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard_11.text: Even in the Underdark, some fools pray to Selûne's light. General will snuff it out soon enough.
BazEntranceGuard_11.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped the cult kidnap Isobel and bring her to Moonrise.NodeContext: Reflecting on the power of the priestess they've captured - relishing the idea of his General breaking her

BazEntranceGuard_14.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard_14.text: Feel that warm glow? A priest of Selûne graces the tower. Sickening, isn't it?
BazEntranceGuard_14.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped the cult kidnap Isobel and bring her to Moonrise.NodeContext: Sarcastic - oh what an honour it is for a priestess of a fancy god to come 'visit' them (she's being held against her will)

BazEntranceGuard_17.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard_17.text: I'll stick near you when the city walls come down, boss. I want to see how much damage you can do.
BazEntranceGuard_17.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Relishing the fight to come

BazEntranceGuard_18.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard_18.text: I hear the General's advisor is back. Which means we'll be hearing the screams of the prisoners again.
BazEntranceGuard_18.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped Balthazar (and this Nightsong) return to Moonrise. He's down in the Colony.NodeContext: Sighing - a little bored with the sounds of torture that come up from below the tower

BazEntranceGuard_22.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard_22.text: We've all got our part in Her design. Just for some, that's mucking out latrines in the war camp.
BazEntranceGuard_22.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)NodeContext: Amused - all these novices have come expecting a grand destiny, and he's assigning them menial tasks

BazaarStander_006_0.speaker: Pilgrim Nalira
BazaarStander_006_0.text: The prisoners below are gone, True Soul. I cannot understand why they would flee Her mercy.
BazaarStander_006_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The prisoners successfully escaped from Moonrise's dungeons (perhaps all, perhaps only one)NodeContext: Confused, hurt - prisoners in the cell escaped - she saw them as heathens her church was trying to 'save'

BazaarStander_006_2.speaker: Pilgrim Nalira
BazaarStander_006_2.text: The people of Baldur's Gate will embrace Her gift. They must.
BazaarStander_006_2.context: InternalNodeContext: The prisoners successfully escaped from Moonrise's dungeons (perhaps all, perhaps only one)NodeContext: Determination, conviction

BazaarStander_006_3.speaker: Pilgrim Nalira
BazaarStander_006_3.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)NodeContext: Head bowed and eyes closed, praying to herself

BazaarStander_006_4.speaker: Pilgrim Nalira
BazaarStander_006_4.text: No gods can stop us. Soon, we bring Her glory to Baldur's Gate.
BazaarStander_006_4.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped the cult kidnap Isobel and bring her to Moonrise.

BazaarStander_006_5.speaker: Pilgrim Nalira
BazaarStander_006_5.text: The cleric from the inn is with us, thanks to you. Even Selûne cannot resist our Absolute.
BazaarStander_006_5.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped the cult kidnap Isobel and bring her to Moonrise.NodeContext: Excited - her god is proving more powerful then the 'old' gods

BazaarStander_006_6.speaker: Pilgrim Nalira
BazaarStander_006_6.text: Disciple Z'rell wants to see us. You, me, all of us. I know she does.
BazaarStander_006_6.context: NodeContext: Eager and a little desperate - she's being kept from seeing a priest

BazaarStander_006_7.speaker: Pilgrim Nalira
BazaarStander_006_7.text: They say you braved the dark to save the General's advisor. Bless you.
BazaarStander_006_7.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped Balthazar (and this Nightsong) return to Moonrise. He's down in the Colony.

BazaarStander_006_8.speaker: Pilgrim Nalira
BazaarStander_006_8.text:
Of many hearts, one soul. Of many thoughts, one mind. Of many parts, one whole.
In Her name, Her design.
BazaarStander_006_8.context: NodeContext: Head bowed and eyes closed, praying to herself. Whispered and quick, as if one passage in a long litany.

BazaarStander_006_9.speaker: Pilgrim Nalira
BazaarStander_006_9.text: She walks with you. I can feel Her.
BazaarStander_006_9.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)NodeContext: Looking up at us with awe, rapturous to be so near a blessed person of her 'god'

BazaarStander_006_10.speaker: Pilgrim Nalira
BazaarStander_006_10.text: The Absolute Herself called us here. They cannot stop us from seeing Z'rell now!
BazaarStander_006_10.context: NodeContext: Eager and a little desperate - she's being kept from seeing a priest

Bystander03_0.speaker: Pilgrim Sul
Bystander03_0.text: She sees everything we are, do you understand? There is no hiding from Her!

Bystander03_1.speaker: Pilgrim Sul
Bystander03_1.text: The Absolute will eat this cleric's light. But it won't be enough - not nearly enough.
Bystander03_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped the cult kidnap Isobel and bring her to Moonrise.NodeContext: Barely suppressed fear of us and the Absolute - but also relishing the sacrifice to come. (Yes, a little mad)

Bystander03_2.speaker: Pilgrim Sul
Bystander03_2.text: You... you brought Her the moon-witch. She is pleased - do you see it in Her eyes?
Bystander03_2.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped the cult kidnap Isobel and bring her to Moonrise.NodeContext: Barely suppressed fear of us and the Absolute - but also relishing the sacrifice to come. (Yes, a little mad)

Bystander03_3.speaker: Pilgrim Sul
Bystander03_3.text: There's eyes In the dark... in the walls. Please stop looking at me. Please.
Bystander03_3.context: NodeContext: Paranoia with a hit of menacing madness

Bystander02_0.speaker: Brawler Wim
Bystander02_0.text: We ought to head out now - burn everything between here and the city.

Bystander02_1.speaker: Brawler Wim
Bystander02_1.text: I caught a glimpse of Ketheric and Z'rell. Wouldn't have the gumption to stick my nose in, like you did, mind.

Bystander02_2.speaker: Brawler Wim
Bystander02_2.text: Shh - I'm tryna hear what's going on in there.

Bystander02_3.speaker: Brawler Wim
Bystander02_3.text: Wouldn't head into the main hall, if I were you. Z'rell and Ketheric are working on some poor worm.

Guard01_0.speaker: Adept Furek
Guard01_0.text: You should go through the main hall. Witnessing the General's justice is an honour.

Guard01_1.speaker: Adept Furek
Guard01_1.text: Welcome back, True Soul. Z'rell is holding an audience with the General - deciding the fate of those who have failed the Absolute.

Guard01_2.speaker: Adept Furek
Guard01_2.text: Did the goblins suffer? Rabble like that don't deserve mercy.

Guard01_3.speaker: Adept Furek
Guard01_3.text: Praise the Absolute. Serve the General.

AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_2.speaker: Brawler Orik
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_2.text: This ain't what we was promised. The Absolute's our god.
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_2.context: NodeContext: Bitter, been quietly seething on this for a while

AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_4.speaker: Brawler Wim
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_4.text: She belongs to everyone, git. That's the point.
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_4.context: NodeContext: Hushing a friend who's saying things that might get them killed

AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_8.speaker: Brawler Weneg
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_8.text: We're all friends, right? All one under the Absolute.
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_8.context: NodeContext: Said with a meaningful tone, overrding the doubts/concerns of his comrade who's speaking blasphemy

AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_1.speaker: Brawler Orik
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_1.text: Don't bloody feel like it, all of a sudden.

AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_5.speaker: Brawler Orik
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_5.text: They bloody killed 'em. What now? Are we next?

AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_9.speaker: Brawler Wim
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_9.text: Not if you keep them lips clapped together.
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_9.context: NodeContext: Low and urgent - hushing loud comrade.

AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_7.speaker: Brawler Weneg
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_7.text: Quiet, both of yas! Ye're drawin' attention.

AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_6.speaker: Brawler Wim
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_6.text: Just focus on the glory to come, yeah? Absolute's picking a fight with the whole damn Coast.
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_6.context: NodeContext: Urging his comrade to stop being a downer, look forward to the fighting to come

AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_3.speaker: Brawler Weneg
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_3.text: And when we win, there'll be loot enough to make us lords.
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution_3.context: NodeContext: Reinforcing his friend's point, trying to cheer up a downer of a comrade

BazaarStander_005_0.speaker: Pilgrim Farimorn
BazaarStander_005_0.text: Blessings, True Soul. We're to march soon - thanks to you.
BazaarStander_005_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Awed by you

BazaarStander_005_1.speaker: Pilgrim Farimorn
BazaarStander_005_1.text: Marching under the same banner as goblins. Her new world is a strange one indeed, is it not?
BazaarStander_005_1.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)

BazaarStander_005_2.speaker: Pilgrim Farimorn
BazaarStander_005_2.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped the cult kidnap Isobel and bring her to Moonrise.NodeContext: A blessing

BazaarStander_005_3.speaker: Pilgrim Farimorn
BazaarStander_005_3.text: I hear it was you who threw down the Selûnite. Her god has no power here - not anymore.
BazaarStander_005_3.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped the cult kidnap Isobel and bring her to Moonrise.NodeContext: Reference to the priestess Isobel - we defeated her

BazaarStander_005_4.speaker: Pilgrim Farimorn
BazaarStander_005_4.text: I can only imagine what reward awaits you. In Her name!
BazaarStander_005_4.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Awe, a little envy - last is a cheerful blessing

BazaarStander_005_5.speaker: Pilgrim Farimorn
BazaarStander_005_5.text: A single tower standing against this darkness. What is that, if not proof of Her power?
BazaarStander_005_5.context: InternalNodeContext: Ketheric is still in private council dealing with some cultists who failed him. Default state on player's first arrival to tower.

BazaarStander_005_6.speaker: Pilgrim Farimorn
BazaarStander_005_6.text: Not all of us survived the shadows to stand here. My wife, my sons... they were unworthy.
BazaarStander_005_6.context: InternalNodeContext: Ketheric is still in private council dealing with some cultists who failed him. Default state on player's first arrival to tower.

BazaarStander_005_7.speaker: Pilgrim Farimorn
BazaarStander_005_7.text: I'm bound for the war camp. I'm no fighter, but... perhaps She sees something I do not.
BazaarStander_005_7.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)
